data.name: Chris Wilson
data.bio: Chris Wilson is an Open Web Platform Developer Advocate on the Google Chrome team.  He started working on web browsers in 1993 when he co-authored the original Windows version of NCSA Mosaic, worked on Internet Explorer for fifteen years at Microsoft, and joined Google in 2010,.  He has a particular interest in enabling awesome user experiences on the web platform, and is a long-time participant in various web standards working groups.

talks.title: Remixing the Web
Remixing the Web
talks.description: In this rocking (literally!) talk, Chris takes two turntables and a microphone to the next step, showing how to build full-blown music production studios in two lines of Javascript code by using the Web Audio API.
